Methods

AdaptiveRecursiveSimpson(Func<double, double>, double, double, double, double)

method to integrate function using adaptive recursive Simpson's rule. Adaptive Simpson's method uses and estimate of the error obtained by calculating the definite integral using Simpson's rule. If the error exceeds a tolerance (15*epsilon) the algorithm subdivides the interval of integration in two and applies adaptive Simpson's rule to each sub-interval in a recursive manner.

public static double AdaptiveRecursiveSimpson(Func<double, double> f, double a, double b, double epsilon, double sum)

Parameters

f Func<double, double>

function to integrate
